subject: Re: JUnit 4 restructuring
msgSnippet: ... continue ... So will I, but the huge advantage of putting it into an official junit release is that it gets promoted to the public, which in turn enables
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Kevin Lawrence <kevin@d...> wrote:
> ...
> I have been playing with assertThat(). I like it a lot and will
continue
> to use it. I will continue to use it whether or not it is part of the
> framework.

So will I, but the huge advantage of putting it into an official junit
release is that it gets promoted to the public, which in turn enables
you to use it in various teams on various projects. Additionally, you
(and many other people who like assertThat) don't have to
write/maintain the same functionality everybody else is
writing/maintaining too.

> I have also been experimenting with using "should" in the names of all
> my tests. I was quite surprised by the positive effect it had on the
> quality of my tests.
> ...

That sounds interesting, how exactly do you use "should"? Could you
give us some examples? How did it improve the quality of your tests?
